intro: Bixa katangensis, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dark seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
